-- | This account identifier is used when attaching a policy to your S3
--   bucket allowing ELB to upload and write access logs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>Attach a Policy to Your S3 Bucket</a>.
getAccountId :: Region -> Maybe Text


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.AccessLog

-- | Information about the <tt>AccessLog</tt> attribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessLog</a> smart constructor.
data AccessLog
AccessLog' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Bool -> AccessLog

-- | The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example <tt>my-bucket-prefix/prod</tt>. If the prefix is not provided,
--   the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
[$sel:s3BucketPrefix:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Maybe Text

-- | The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
[$sel:emitInterval:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.
[$sel:s3BucketName:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.
[$sel:enabled:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessLog</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketPrefix:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_s3BucketPrefix</a>
--   - The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example <tt>my-bucket-prefix/prod</tt>. If the prefix is not provided,
--   the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emitInterval:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_emitInterval</a> -
--   The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_s3BucketName</a> -

--

--   whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.
newAccessLog :: Bool -> AccessLog

-- | The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example <tt>my-bucket-prefix/prod</tt>. If the prefix is not provided,
--   the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
accessLog_s3BucketPrefix :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Text)

-- | The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
accessLog_emitInterval :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.
accessLog_s3BucketName :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.
accessLog_enabled :: Lens' AccessLog Bool

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.AccessLog.AccessLog

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.AdditionalAttribute

-- | Information about additional load balancer attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdditionalAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data AdditionalAttribute
AdditionalAttribute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AdditionalAttribute

-- | The name of the attribute.
--   
--   The following attribute is supported.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>elb.http.desyncmitigationmode</tt> - Determines how the load
--   balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your
--   application. The possible values are <tt>monitor</tt>,
--   <tt>defensive</tt>, and <tt>strictest</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>defensive</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>elb.http.desyncmitigationmode</tt> - Determines how the load
--   balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your
--   application. The possible values are <tt>monitor</tt>,
--   <tt>defensive</tt>, and <tt>strictest</tt>. The default is

--   </ul>

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck

-- | Information about a health check.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHealthCheck</a> smart constructor.
data HealthCheck
HealthCheck' :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> HealthCheck

-- | The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS,
--   or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   "TCP:5000". In this case, a health check simply attempts to open a TCP
--   connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to connect
--   within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80/weather/us/wa/seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET request is
--   issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any answer other
--   than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
[$sel:target:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Text

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
[$sel:interval:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
[$sel:timeout:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the instance to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
[$sel:unhealthyThreshold:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the instance to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
[$sel:healthyThreshold:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HealthCheck</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:HealthCheck'</a>, <a>healthCheck_target</a> - The
--   instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS, or
--   SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   "TCP:5000". In this case, a health check simply attempts to open a TCP
--   connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to connect
--   within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80/weather/us/wa/seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET request is
--   issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any answer other
--   than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
--   
--   <a>$sel:interval:HealthCheck'</a>, <a>healthCheck_interval</a> - The
--   approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeout:HealthCheck'</a>, <a>healthCheck_timeout</a> - The
--   amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed
--   health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unhealthyThreshold:HealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>healthCheck_unhealthyThreshold</a> - The number of consecutive
--   health check failures required before moving the instance to the
--   <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthyThreshold:HealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>healthCheck_healthyThreshold</a> - The number of consecutive health
--   checks successes required before moving the instance to the
--   <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
newHealthCheck :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> HealthCheck

-- | The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS,
--   or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   "TCP:5000". In this case, a health check simply attempts to open a TCP
--   connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to connect
--   within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80/weather/us/wa/seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET request is
--   issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any answer other
--   than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
healthCheck_target :: Lens' HealthCheck Text

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
healthCheck_interval :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
healthCheck_timeout :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the instance to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
healthCheck_unhealthyThreshold :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the instance to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
healthCheck_healthyThreshold :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.Types.HealthCheck.HealthCheck

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState

-- | Information about the state of an EC2 instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceState</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceState
InstanceState' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InstanceState

-- | The ID of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>ELB</tt> | <tt>Instance</tt> | <tt>N/A</tt>
[$sel:reasonCode:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
[$sel:state:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the instance state. This string can contain one or
--   more of the following messages.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>N/A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>A transient error occurred. Please try again
--   later.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold
--   number of health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance registration is still in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which
--   LoadBalancer is not configured to route traffic to.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is not currently registered with the
--   LoadBalancer.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance deregistration currently in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Disable Availability Zone is currently in
--   progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in pending state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in stopped state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in terminated state.</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:description:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_instanceId</a>
--   - The ID of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_reasonCode</a>
--   - Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>ELB</tt> | <tt>Instance</tt> | <tt>N/A</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_state</a> - The
--   current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:InstanceState'</a>,
--   <a>instanceState_description</a> - A description of the instance
--   state. This string can contain one or more of the following messages.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>N/A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>A transient error occurred. Please try again
--   later.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold
--   number of health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance registration is still in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which
--   LoadBalancer is not configured to route traffic to.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is not currently registered with the
--   LoadBalancer.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance deregistration currently in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Disable Availability Zone is currently in
--   progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in pending state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in stopped state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in terminated state.</pre></li>
--   </ul>
newInstanceState :: InstanceState

-- | The ID of the instance.
instanceState_instanceId :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>ELB</tt> | <tt>Instance</tt> | <tt>N/A</tt>
instanceState_reasonCode :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
instanceState_state :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the instance state. This string can contain one or
--   more of the following messages.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>N/A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>A transient error occurred. Please try again
--   later.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold
--   number of health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance registration is still in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which
--   LoadBalancer is not configured to route traffic to.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is not currently registered with the
--   LoadBalancer.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance deregistration currently in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Disable Availability Zone is currently in
--   progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in pending state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in stopped state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in terminated state.</pre></li>
--   </ul>
instanceState_description :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | Information about a policy for duration-based session stickiness.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLBCookieStickinessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data LBCookieStickinessPolicy
LBCookieStickinessPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The name of the policy. This name must be unique within the set of
--   policies for this load balancer.
[$sel:policyName:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'] :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be
--   considered stale. If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness
--   session lasts for the duration of the browser session.
[$sel:cookieExpirationPeriod:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'] :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>LBCookieStickinessPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>lBCookieStickinessPolicy_policyName</a> - The name of the policy.
--   This name must be unique within the set of policies for this load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cookieExpirationPeriod:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>lBCookieStickinessPolicy_cookieExpirationPeriod</a> - The time
--   period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be considered stale.
--   If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness session lasts for
--   the duration of the browser session.
newLBCookieStickinessPolicy :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The name of the policy. This name must be unique within the set of
--   policies for this load balancer.
lBCookieStickinessPolicy_policyName :: Lens' LBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be
--   considered stale. If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness
--   session lasts for the duration of the browser session.
lBCookieStickinessPolicy_cookieExpirationPeriod :: Lens' LBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LBCookieStickinessPolicy.LBCookieStickinessPolicy


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit

-- | Information about an Elastic Load Balancing resource limit for your
--   AWS account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLimit</a> smart constructor.
data Limit
Limit' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Limit

-- | The name of the limit. The possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classic-listeners</li>
--   <li>classic-load-balancers</li>
--   <li>classic-registered-instances</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:Limit'] :: Limit -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum value of the limit.
[$sel:max:Limit'] :: Limit -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Limit</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Limit'</a>, <a>limit_name</a> - The name of the limit.
--   The possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classic-listeners</li>
--   <li>classic-load-balancers</li>
--   <li>classic-registered-instances</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:Limit'</a>, <a>limit_max</a> - The maximum value of the
--   limit.
newLimit :: Limit

-- | The name of the limit. The possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classic-listeners</li>
--   <li>classic-load-balancers</li>
--   <li>classic-registered-instances</li>
--   </ul>
limit_name :: Lens' Limit (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum value of the limit.
limit_max :: Lens' Limit (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Limit.Limit


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener

-- | Information about a listener.
--   
--   For information about the protocols and the ports supported by Elastic
--   Load Balancing, see <a>Listeners for Your Classic Load Balancer</a> in
--   the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListener</a> smart constructor.
data Listener
Listener' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Int -> Natural -> Listener

-- | The protocol to use for routing traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is TCP or SSL, the back-end protocol must be
--   TCP or SSL. If the front-end protocol is HTTP or HTTPS, the back-end
--   protocol must be HTTP or HTTPS.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
[$sel:instanceProtocol:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.
[$sel:sSLCertificateId:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe Text

-- | The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
[$sel:protocol:Listener'] :: Listener -> Text

-- | The port on which the load balancer is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can
--   specify any port from the range 1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can
--   specify any port from the following list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587,
--   1024-65535.
[$sel:loadBalancerPort:Listener'] :: Listener -> Int

-- | The port on which the instance is listening.
[$sel:instancePort:Listener'] :: Listener -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Listener</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProtocol:Listener'</a>,
--   <a>listener_instanceProtocol</a> - The protocol to use for routing
--   traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is TCP or SSL, the back-end protocol must be
--   TCP or SSL. If the front-end protocol is HTTP or HTTPS, the back-end
--   protocol must be HTTP or HTTPS.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSLCertificateId:Listener'</a>,
--   <a>listener_sSLCertificateId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the server certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_protocol</a> - The load
--   balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or
--   SSL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerPort:Listener'</a>,
--   <a>listener_loadBalancerPort</a> - The port on which the load balancer
--   is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can specify any port from the range
--   1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can specify any port from the following
--   list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587, 1024-65535.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancePort:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_instancePort</a> - The
--   port on which the instance is listening.
newListener :: Text -> Int -> Natural -> Listener

-- | The protocol to use for routing traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is TCP or SSL, the back-end protocol must be
--   TCP or SSL. If the front-end protocol is HTTP or HTTPS, the back-end
--   protocol must be HTTP or HTTPS.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
listener_instanceProtocol :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.
listener_sSLCertificateId :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)

-- | The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
listener_protocol :: Lens' Listener Text

-- | The port on which the load balancer is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can
--   specify any port from the range 1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can
--   specify any port from the following list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587,
--   1024-65535.
listener_loadBalancerPort :: Lens' Listener Int

-- | The port on which the instance is listening.
listener_instancePort :: Lens' Listener Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Listener.Listener


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription

-- | The policies enabled for a listener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListenerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data ListenerDescription
ListenerDescription' :: Maybe Listener -> Maybe [Text] -> ListenerDescription

-- | The listener.
[$sel:listener:ListenerDescription'] :: ListenerDescription -> Maybe Listener

-- | The policies. If there are no policies enabled, the list is empty.
[$sel:policyNames:ListenerDescription'] :: ListenerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListenerDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:listener:ListenerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>listenerDescription_listener</a> - The listener.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNames:ListenerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>listenerDescription_policyNames</a> - The policies. If there are no
--   policies enabled, the list is empty.
newListenerDescription :: ListenerDescription

-- | The listener.
listenerDescription_listener :: Lens' ListenerDescription (Maybe Listener)

-- | The policies. If there are no policies enabled, the list is empty.
listenerDescription_policyNames :: Lens' ListenerDescription (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.ListenerDescription.ListenerDescription


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | The attributes for a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerAttributes
LoadBalancerAttributes' :: Maybe ConnectionDraining -> Maybe [AdditionalAttribute] -> Maybe ConnectionSettings -> Maybe AccessLog -> Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing -> LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete
--   before the load balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or
--   unhealthy instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:connectionDraining:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe ConnectionDraining

-- | Any additional attributes.
[$sel:additionalAttributes:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe [AdditionalAttribute]

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows the connections to remain idle
--   (no data is sent over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:connectionSettings:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe ConnectionSettings

-- | If enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information of all
--   requests and delivers the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you
--   specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Classic
--   Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:accessLog:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe AccessLog

-- | If enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across
--   all instances regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:crossZoneLoadBalancing:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionDraining:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_connectionDraining</a> - If enabled, the
--   load balancer allows existing requests to complete before the load
--   balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or unhealthy
--   instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalAttributes:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_additionalAttributes</a> - Any additional
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionSettings:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_connectionSettings</a> - If enabled, the
--   load balancer allows the connections to remain idle (no data is sent
--   over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessLog:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_accessLog</a> - If enabled, the load
--   balancer captures detailed information of all requests and delivers
--   the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Classic
--   Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:crossZoneLoadBalancing:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_crossZoneLoadBalancing</a> - If enabled, the
--   load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across all instances
--   regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
newLoadBalancerAttributes :: LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete
--   before the load balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or
--   unhealthy instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_connectionDraining :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe ConnectionDraining)

-- | Any additional attributes.
loadBalancerAttributes_additionalAttributes :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe [AdditionalAttribute])

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows the connections to remain idle
--   (no data is sent over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_connectionSettings :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe ConnectionSettings)

-- | If enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information of all
--   requests and delivers the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you
--   specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Classic
--   Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_accessLog :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe AccessLog)

-- | If enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across
--   all instances regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_crossZoneLoadBalancing :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerAttributes.LoadBalancerAttributes


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies

-- | The policies for a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicies</a> smart constructor.
data Policies
Policies' :: Maybe [AppCookieStickinessPolicy] -> Maybe [LBCookieStickinessPolicy] -> Maybe [Text] -> Policies

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.
[$sel:appCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'] :: Policies -> Maybe [AppCookieStickinessPolicy]

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.
[$sel:lBCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'] :: Policies -> Maybe [LBCookieStickinessPolicy]

-- | The policies other than the stickiness policies.
[$sel:otherPolicies:Policies'] :: Policies -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Policies</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:appCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'</a>,
--   <a>policies_appCookieStickinessPolicies</a> - The stickiness policies
--   created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lBCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'</a>,
--   <a>policies_lBCookieStickinessPolicies</a> - The stickiness policies
--   created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otherPolicies:Policies'</a>, <a>policies_otherPolicies</a> -
--   The policies other than the stickiness policies.
newPolicies :: Policies

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.
policies_appCookieStickinessPolicies :: Lens' Policies (Maybe [AppCookieStickinessPolicy])

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.
policies_lBCookieStickinessPolicies :: Lens' Policies (Maybe [LBCookieStickinessPolicy])

-- | The policies other than the stickiness policies.
policies_otherPolicies :: Lens' Policies (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Policies.Policies


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttribute

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyAttribute
PolicyAttribute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PolicyAttribute

-- | The value of the attribute.
[$sel:attributeValue:PolicyAttribute'] :: PolicyAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute.
[$sel:attributeName:PolicyAttribute'] :: PolicyAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyAttribute</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeValue:PolicyAttribute'</a>,

--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:PolicyAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttribute_attributeName</a> - The name of the attribute.
newPolicyAttribute :: PolicyAttribute

-- | The value of the attribute.

-- | The name of the attribute.
policyAttribute_attributeName :: Lens' PolicyAttribute (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription

-- | Information about a policy attribute type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyAttributeTypeDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
PolicyAttributeTypeDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PolicyAttributeTypeDescription

-- | The type of the attribute. For example, <tt>Boolean</tt> or
--   <tt>Integer</tt>.
[$sel:attributeType:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute.
[$sel:attributeName:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The cardinality of the attribute.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE(1) : Single value required</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_ONE(0..1) : Up to one value is allowed</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_MORE(0..*) : Optional. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   <li>ONE_OR_MORE(1..*0) : Required. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:cardinality:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the attribute.
[$sel:description:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The default value of the attribute, if applicable.
[$sel:defaultValue:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyAttributeTypeDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_attributeType</a> - The type of the
--   attribute. For example, <tt>Boolean</tt> or <tt>Integer</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_attributeName</a> - The name of the
--   attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cardinality:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_cardinality</a> - The cardinality of
--   the attribute.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE(1) : Single value required</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_ONE(0..1) : Up to one value is allowed</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_MORE(0..*) : Optional. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   <li>ONE_OR_MORE(1..*0) : Required. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_description</a> - A description of
--   the attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultValue:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_defaultValue</a> - The default value
--   of the attribute, if applicable.
newPolicyAttributeTypeDescription :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription

-- | The type of the attribute. For example, <tt>Boolean</tt> or
--   <tt>Integer</tt>.
policyAttributeTypeDescription_attributeType :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the attribute.
policyAttributeTypeDescription_attributeName :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The cardinality of the attribute.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE(1) : Single value required</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_ONE(0..1) : Up to one value is allowed</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_MORE(0..*) : Optional. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   <li>ONE_OR_MORE(1..*0) : Required. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   </ul>
policyAttributeTypeDescription_cardinality :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the attribute.
policyAttributeTypeDescription_description :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The default value of the attribute, if applicable.
policyAttributeTypeDescription_defaultValue :: Lens' PolicyAttributeTypeDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription.PolicyAttributeTypeDescription


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyDescription

-- | Information about a policy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyDescription</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyDescription
PolicyDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicyAttributeDescription] -> PolicyDescription

-- | The name of the policy.
[$sel:policyName:PolicyDescription'] :: PolicyDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the policy type.
[$sel:policyTypeName:PolicyDescription'] :: PolicyDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy attributes.
[$sel:policyAttributeDescriptions:PolicyDescription'] :: PolicyDescription -> Maybe [PolicyAttributeDescription]

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:PolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyDescription_policyName</a> - The name of the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyTypeName:PolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyDescription_policyTypeName</a> - The name of the policy type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyAttributeDescriptions:PolicyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyDescription_policyAttributeDescriptions</a> - The policy
--   attributes.
newPolicyDescription :: PolicyDescription

-- | The name of the policy.
policyDescription_policyName :: Lens' PolicyDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the policy type.
policyDescription_policyTypeName :: Lens' PolicyDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy attributes.
policyDescription_policyAttributeDescriptions :: Lens' PolicyDescription (Maybe [PolicyAttributeDescription])

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyDescription.PolicyDescription

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyDescription.PolicyDescription

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.PolicyTypeDescription

-- | Information about a policy type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyTypeDescription</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyTypeDescription
PolicyTypeDescription' :: Maybe [PolicyAttributeTypeDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PolicyTypeDescription

-- | The description of the policy attributes associated with the policies
--   defined by Elastic Load Balancing.
[$sel:policyAttributeTypeDescriptions:PolicyTypeDescription'] :: PolicyTypeDescription -> Maybe [PolicyAttributeTypeDescription]

-- | The name of the policy type.
[$sel:policyTypeName:PolicyTypeDescription'] :: PolicyTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

--   defined by Elastic Load Balancing.

--   <a>$sel:policyTypeName:PolicyTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyTypeDescription_policyTypeName</a> - The name of the policy
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PolicyTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyTypeDescription_description</a> - A description of the policy
--   type.

--   defined by Elastic Load Balancing.

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.SourceSecurityGroup

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription

-- | Information about a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerDescription
LoadBalancerDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [BackendServerDescription] -> Maybe Policies -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Instance] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SourceSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ListenerDescription] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HealthCheck -> Maybe Text -> LoadBalancerDescription

-- | The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.
[$sel:canonicalHostedZoneNameID:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zones for the load balancer.
[$sel:availabilityZones:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Information about your EC2 instances.
[$sel:backendServerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [BackendServerDescription]

-- | The policies defined for the load balancer.
[$sel:policies:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Policies

-- | The type of load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internet-facing</tt>, the load balancer has
--   a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
[$sel:scheme:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the load balancer was created.
[$sel:createdTime:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The IDs of the instances for the load balancer.
[$sel:instances:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Instance]

-- | The security groups for the load balancer. Valid only for load
--   balancers in a VPC.
[$sel:securityGroups:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The security group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of
--   your inbound rules for your registered instances. To only allow
--   traffic from load balancers, add a security group rule that specifies
--   this source security group as the inbound source.
[$sel:sourceSecurityGroup:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe SourceSecurityGroup

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
[$sel:dNSName:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The listeners for the load balancer.
[$sel:listenerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [ListenerDescription]

-- | The IDs of the subnets for the load balancer.
[$sel:subnets:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.
[$sel:vPCId:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the health checks conducted on the load balancer.
[$sel:healthCheck:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe HealthCheck

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure a Custom Domain Name</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:canonicalHostedZoneName:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:canonicalHostedZoneNameID:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneNameID</a> - The ID of
--   the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_availabilityZones</a> - The Availability
--   Zones for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backendServerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_backendServerDescriptions</a> - Information
--   about your EC2 instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_policies</a> - The policies defined for the
--   load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheme:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_scheme</a> - The type of load balancer.
--   Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internet-facing</tt>, the load balancer has
--   a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_createdTime</a> - The date and time the
--   load balancer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instances:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_instances</a> - The IDs of the instances
--   for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroups:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_securityGroups</a> - The security groups
--   for the load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSecurityGroup:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_sourceSecurityGroup</a> - The security
--   group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of your inbound
--   rules for your registered instances. To only allow traffic from load
--   balancers, add a security group rule that specifies this source
--   security group as the inbound source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dNSName:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_dNSName</a> - The DNS name of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listenerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_listenerDescriptions</a> - The listeners
--   for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnets:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_subnets</a> - The IDs of the subnets for
--   the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vPCId:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_vPCId</a> - The ID of the VPC for the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_loadBalancerName</a> - The name of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheck:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_healthCheck</a> - Information about the
--   health checks conducted on the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:canonicalHostedZoneName:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneName</a> - The DNS name
--   of the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure a Custom Domain Name</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
newLoadBalancerDescription :: LoadBalancerDescription

-- | The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneNameID :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zones for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_availabilityZones :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | Information about your EC2 instances.
loadBalancerDescription_backendServerDescriptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [BackendServerDescription])

-- | The policies defined for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_policies :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Policies)

-- | The type of load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internet-facing</tt>, the load balancer has
--   a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
loadBalancerDescription_scheme :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the load balancer was created.
loadBalancerDescription_createdTime :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The IDs of the instances for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_instances :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Instance])

-- | The security groups for the load balancer. Valid only for load
--   balancers in a VPC.
loadBalancerDescription_securityGroups :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The security group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of
--   your inbound rules for your registered instances. To only allow
--   traffic from load balancers, add a security group rule that specifies
--   this source security group as the inbound source.
loadBalancerDescription_sourceSecurityGroup :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe SourceSecurityGroup)

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_dNSName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The listeners for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_listenerDescriptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [ListenerDescription])

-- | The IDs of the subnets for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_subnets :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_vPCId :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_loadBalancerName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the health checks conducted on the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_healthCheck :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe HealthCheck)

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure a Custom Domain Name</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.LoadBalancerDescription.LoadBalancerDescription


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag

-- | Information about a tag.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The value of the tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Maybe Text

-- | The key of the tag.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value of the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key of the tag.
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | The value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The key of the tag.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription

-- | The tags associated with a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTagDescription</a> smart constructor.
data TagDescription
TagDescription' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Tag) -> Maybe Text -> TagDescription

-- | The tags.
[$sel:tags:TagDescription'] :: TagDescription -> Maybe (NonEmpty Tag)

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:TagDescription'] :: TagDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagDescription'</a>, <a>tagDescription_tags</a> - The
--   tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:TagDescription'</a>,
--   <a>tagDescription_loadBalancerName</a> - The name of the load
--   balancer.
newTagDescription :: TagDescription

-- | The tags.
tagDescription_tags :: Lens' TagDescription (Maybe (NonEmpty Tag))

-- | The name of the load balancer.
tagDescription_loadBalancerName :: Lens' TagDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.Types.TagDescription.TagDescription

module Network.AWS.ELB.Types

-- | API version <tt>2012-06-01</tt> of the Amazon Elastic Load Balancing
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | A policy with the specified name already exists for this load
--   balancer.
_DuplicatePolicyNameException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested configuration change is not valid.
_InvalidConfigurationRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified load balancer name already exists for this account.
_DuplicateAccessPointNameException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One or more of the specified security groups do not exist.
_InvalidSecurityGroupException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One or more of the specified policy types do not exist.
_PolicyTypeNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified load balancer does not exist.
_AccessPointNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The quota for the number of tags that can be assigned to a load
--   balancer has been reached.
_TooManyTagsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A tag key was specified more than once.
_DuplicateTagKeysException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The quota for the number of policies for this load balancer has been
--   reached.
_TooManyPoliciesException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A request made by Elastic Load Balancing to another service exceeds
--   the maximum request rate permitted for your account.
_DependencyThrottleException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This operation is not allowed.
_OperationNotPermittedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified endpoint is not valid.
_InvalidEndPointException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified load balancer attribute does not exist.
_LoadBalancerAttributeNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The load balancer does not have a listener configured at the specified
--   port.
_ListenerNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One or more of the specified subnets do not exist.
_SubnetNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One or more of the specified policies do not exist.
_PolicyNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified protocol or signature version is not supported.
_UnsupportedProtocolException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified ARN does not refer to a valid SSL certificate in AWS
--   Identity and Access Management (IAM) or AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
--   Note that if you recently uploaded the certificate to IAM, this error
--   might indicate that the certificate is not fully available yet.
_CertificateNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A listener already exists for the specified load balancer name and
--   port, but with a different instance port, protocol, or SSL
--   certificate.
_DuplicateListenerException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified value for the schema is not valid. You can only specify
--   a scheme for load balancers in a VPC.
_InvalidSchemeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The quota for the number of load balancers has been reached.
_TooManyAccessPointsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified VPC has no associated Internet gateway.
_InvalidSubnetException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Information about the <tt>AccessLog</tt> attribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessLog</a> smart constructor.
data AccessLog
AccessLog' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Bool -> AccessLog

-- | The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example <tt>my-bucket-prefix/prod</tt>. If the prefix is not provided,
--   the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
[$sel:s3BucketPrefix:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Maybe Text

-- | The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
[$sel:emitInterval:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.
[$sel:s3BucketName:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.
[$sel:enabled:AccessLog'] :: AccessLog -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessLog</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketPrefix:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_s3BucketPrefix</a>
--   - The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example <tt>my-bucket-prefix/prod</tt>. If the prefix is not provided,
--   the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emitInterval:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_emitInterval</a> -
--   The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_s3BucketName</a> -
--   The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:AccessLog'</a>, <a>accessLog_enabled</a> - Specifies
--   whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.
newAccessLog :: Bool -> AccessLog

-- | The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for
--   example <tt>my-bucket-prefix/prod</tt>. If the prefix is not provided,
--   the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.
accessLog_s3BucketPrefix :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Text)

-- | The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an
--   interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.
--   
--   Default: 60 minutes
accessLog_emitInterval :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.
accessLog_s3BucketName :: Lens' AccessLog (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.
accessLog_enabled :: Lens' AccessLog Bool

-- | Information about additional load balancer attributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdditionalAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data AdditionalAttribute
AdditionalAttribute' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AdditionalAttribute

-- | The name of the attribute.
--   
--   The following attribute is supported.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>elb.http.desyncmitigationmode</tt> - Determines how the load
--   balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your
--   application. The possible values are <tt>monitor</tt>,
--   <tt>defensive</tt>, and <tt>strictest</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>defensive</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:key:AdditionalAttribute'] :: AdditionalAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | This value of the attribute.
[$sel:value:AdditionalAttribute'] :: AdditionalAttribute -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AdditionalAttribute</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:AdditionalAttribute'</a>, <a>additionalAttribute_key</a> -
--   The name of the attribute.
--   
--   The following attribute is supported.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>elb.http.desyncmitigationmode</tt> - Determines how the load
--   balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your
--   application. The possible values are <tt>monitor</tt>,
--   <tt>defensive</tt>, and <tt>strictest</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>defensive</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:AdditionalAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>additionalAttribute_value</a> - This value of the attribute.
newAdditionalAttribute :: AdditionalAttribute

-- | The name of the attribute.
--   
--   The following attribute is supported.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>elb.http.desyncmitigationmode</tt> - Determines how the load
--   balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your
--   application. The possible values are <tt>monitor</tt>,
--   <tt>defensive</tt>, and <tt>strictest</tt>. The default is
--   <tt>defensive</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
additionalAttribute_key :: Lens' AdditionalAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | This value of the attribute.
additionalAttribute_value :: Lens' AdditionalAttribute (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a policy for application-controlled session
--   stickiness.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAppCookieStickinessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AppCookieStickinessPolicy
AppCookieStickinessPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AppCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The mnemonic name for the policy being created. The name must be
--   unique within a set of policies for this load balancer.
[$sel:policyName:AppCookieStickinessPolicy'] :: AppCookieStickinessPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the application cookie used for stickiness.
[$sel:cookieName:AppCookieStickinessPolicy'] :: AppCookieStickinessPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AppCookieStickinessPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:AppCookieStickinessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>appCookieStickinessPolicy_policyName</a> - The mnemonic name for
--   the policy being created. The name must be unique within a set of
--   policies for this load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cookieName:AppCookieStickinessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>appCookieStickinessPolicy_cookieName</a> - The name of the
--   application cookie used for stickiness.
newAppCookieStickinessPolicy :: AppCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The mnemonic name for the policy being created. The name must be
--   unique within a set of policies for this load balancer.
appCookieStickinessPolicy_policyName :: Lens' AppCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the application cookie used for stickiness.
appCookieStickinessPolicy_cookieName :: Lens' AppCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the configuration of an EC2 instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBackendServerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data BackendServerDescription
BackendServerDescription' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> BackendServerDescription

-- | The port on which the EC2 instance is listening.
[$sel:instancePort:BackendServerDescription'] :: BackendServerDescription -> Maybe Natural

-- | The names of the policies enabled for the EC2 instance.
[$sel:policyNames:BackendServerDescription'] :: BackendServerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>BackendServerDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancePort:BackendServerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>backendServerDescription_instancePort</a> - The port on which the
--   EC2 instance is listening.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNames:BackendServerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>backendServerDescription_policyNames</a> - The names of the
--   policies enabled for the EC2 instance.
newBackendServerDescription :: BackendServerDescription

-- | The port on which the EC2 instance is listening.
backendServerDescription_instancePort :: Lens' BackendServerDescription (Maybe Natural)

-- | The names of the policies enabled for the EC2 instance.
backendServerDescription_policyNames :: Lens' BackendServerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | Information about the <tt>ConnectionDraining</tt> attribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnectionDraining</a> smart constructor.
data ConnectionDraining
ConnectionDraining' :: Maybe Int -> Bool -> ConnectionDraining

-- | The maximum time, in seconds, to keep the existing connections open
--   before deregistering the instances.
[$sel:timeout:ConnectionDraining'] :: ConnectionDraining -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether connection draining is enabled for the load
--   balancer.
[$sel:enabled:ConnectionDraining'] :: ConnectionDraining -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ConnectionDraining</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeout:ConnectionDraining'</a>,
--   <a>connectionDraining_timeout</a> - The maximum time, in seconds, to
--   keep the existing connections open before deregistering the instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:ConnectionDraining'</a>,
--   <a>connectionDraining_enabled</a> - Specifies whether connection
--   draining is enabled for the load balancer.
newConnectionDraining :: Bool -> ConnectionDraining

-- | The maximum time, in seconds, to keep the existing connections open
--   before deregistering the instances.
connectionDraining_timeout :: Lens' ConnectionDraining (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether connection draining is enabled for the load
--   balancer.
connectionDraining_enabled :: Lens' ConnectionDraining Bool

-- | Information about the <tt>ConnectionSettings</tt> attribute.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newConnectionSettings</a> smart constructor.
data ConnectionSettings
ConnectionSettings' :: Natural -> ConnectionSettings

-- | The time, in seconds, that the connection is allowed to be idle (no
--   data has been sent over the connection) before it is closed by the
--   load balancer.
[$sel:idleTimeout:ConnectionSettings'] :: ConnectionSettings -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ConnectionSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>connectionSettings_idleTimeout</a> - The time, in seconds, that the
--   connection is allowed to be idle (no data has been sent over the
--   connection) before it is closed by the load balancer.
newConnectionSettings :: Natural -> ConnectionSettings

-- | The time, in seconds, that the connection is allowed to be idle (no
--   data has been sent over the connection) before it is closed by the
--   load balancer.
connectionSettings_idleTimeout :: Lens' ConnectionSettings Natural

-- | Information about the <tt>CrossZoneLoadBalancing</tt> attribute.

data CrossZoneLoadBalancing

--   balancer.

--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   load balancing is enabled for the load balancer.
newCrossZoneLoadBalancing :: Bool -> CrossZoneLoadBalancing
