--   balancer.
crossZoneLoadBalancing_enabled :: Lens' CrossZoneLoadBalancing Bool

-- | Information about a health check.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHealthCheck</a> smart constructor.
data HealthCheck
HealthCheck' :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> HealthCheck

-- | The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS,
--   or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   "TCP:5000". In this case, a health check simply attempts to open a TCP
--   connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to connect
--   within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80/weather/us/wa/seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET request is
--   issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any answer other
--   than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
[$sel:target:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Text

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
[$sel:interval:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
[$sel:timeout:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the instance to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
[$sel:unhealthyThreshold:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the instance to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
[$sel:healthyThreshold:HealthCheck'] :: HealthCheck -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>HealthCheck</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:HealthCheck'</a>, <a>healthCheck_target</a> - The
--   instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS, or
--   SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   "TCP:5000". In this case, a health check simply attempts to open a TCP
--   connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to connect
--   within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80/weather/us/wa/seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET request is
--   issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any answer other
--   than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
--   
--   <a>$sel:interval:HealthCheck'</a>, <a>healthCheck_interval</a> - The
--   approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeout:HealthCheck'</a>, <a>healthCheck_timeout</a> - The
--   amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed
--   health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unhealthyThreshold:HealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>healthCheck_unhealthyThreshold</a> - The number of consecutive
--   health check failures required before moving the instance to the
--   <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthyThreshold:HealthCheck'</a>,
--   <a>healthCheck_healthyThreshold</a> - The number of consecutive health
--   checks successes required before moving the instance to the
--   <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
newHealthCheck :: Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> HealthCheck

-- | The instance being checked. The protocol is either TCP, HTTP, HTTPS,
--   or SSL. The range of valid ports is one (1) through 65535.
--   
--   TCP is the default, specified as a TCP: port pair, for example
--   "TCP:5000". In this case, a health check simply attempts to open a TCP
--   connection to the instance on the specified port. Failure to connect
--   within the configured timeout is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   SSL is also specified as SSL: port pair, for example, SSL:5000.
--   
--   For HTTP/HTTPS, you must include a ping path in the string. HTTP is
--   specified as a HTTP:port;/;PathToPing; grouping, for example
--   "HTTP:80/weather/us/wa/seattle". In this case, a HTTP GET request is
--   issued to the instance on the given port and path. Any answer other
--   than "200 OK" within the timeout period is considered unhealthy.
--   
--   The total length of the HTTP ping target must be 1024 16-bit Unicode
--   characters or less.
healthCheck_target :: Lens' HealthCheck Text

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual instance.
healthCheck_interval :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check.
--   
--   This value must be less than the <tt>Interval</tt> value.
healthCheck_timeout :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the instance to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state.
healthCheck_unhealthyThreshold :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the instance to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state.
healthCheck_healthyThreshold :: Lens' HealthCheck Natural

-- | The ID of an EC2 instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe Text -> Instance

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
newInstance :: Instance

-- | The instance ID.
instance_instanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the state of an EC2 instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceState</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceState
InstanceState' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InstanceState

-- | The ID of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>ELB</tt> | <tt>Instance</tt> | <tt>N/A</tt>
[$sel:reasonCode:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | The current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
[$sel:state:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the instance state. This string can contain one or
--   more of the following messages.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>N/A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>A transient error occurred. Please try again
--   later.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold
--   number of health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance registration is still in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which
--   LoadBalancer is not configured to route traffic to.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is not currently registered with the
--   LoadBalancer.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance deregistration currently in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Disable Availability Zone is currently in
--   progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in pending state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in stopped state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in terminated state.</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:description:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_instanceId</a>
--   - The ID of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reasonCode:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_reasonCode</a>
--   - Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>ELB</tt> | <tt>Instance</tt> | <tt>N/A</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_state</a> - The
--   current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:InstanceState'</a>,
--   <a>instanceState_description</a> - A description of the instance
--   state. This string can contain one or more of the following messages.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>N/A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>A transient error occurred. Please try again
--   later.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold
--   number of health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance registration is still in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which
--   LoadBalancer is not configured to route traffic to.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is not currently registered with the
--   LoadBalancer.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance deregistration currently in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Disable Availability Zone is currently in
--   progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in pending state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in stopped state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in terminated state.</pre></li>
--   </ul>
newInstanceState :: InstanceState

-- | The ID of the instance.
instanceState_instanceId :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the cause of <tt>OutOfService</tt> instances.
--   Specifically, whether the cause is Elastic Load Balancing or the
--   instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>ELB</tt> | <tt>Instance</tt> | <tt>N/A</tt>
instanceState_reasonCode :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | The current state of the instance.
--   
--   Valid values: <tt>InService</tt> | <tt>OutOfService</tt> |
--   <tt>Unknown</tt>
instanceState_state :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | A description of the instance state. This string can contain one or
--   more of the following messages.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>N/A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>A transient error occurred. Please try again
--   later.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has failed at least the UnhealthyThreshold number of
--   health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance has not passed the configured HealthyThreshold
--   number of health checks consecutively.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance registration is still in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in the EC2 Availability Zone for which
--   LoadBalancer is not configured to route traffic to.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is not currently registered with the
--   LoadBalancer.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance deregistration currently in progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Disable Availability Zone is currently in
--   progress.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in pending state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in stopped state.</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Instance is in terminated state.</pre></li>
--   </ul>
instanceState_description :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a policy for duration-based session stickiness.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLBCookieStickinessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data LBCookieStickinessPolicy
LBCookieStickinessPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The name of the policy. This name must be unique within the set of
--   policies for this load balancer.
[$sel:policyName:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'] :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be
--   considered stale. If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness
--   session lasts for the duration of the browser session.
[$sel:cookieExpirationPeriod:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'] :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>LBCookieStickinessPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>lBCookieStickinessPolicy_policyName</a> - The name of the policy.
--   This name must be unique within the set of policies for this load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cookieExpirationPeriod:LBCookieStickinessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>lBCookieStickinessPolicy_cookieExpirationPeriod</a> - The time
--   period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be considered stale.
--   If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness session lasts for
--   the duration of the browser session.
newLBCookieStickinessPolicy :: LBCookieStickinessPolicy

-- | The name of the policy. This name must be unique within the set of
--   policies for this load balancer.
lBCookieStickinessPolicy_policyName :: Lens' LBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The time period, in seconds, after which the cookie should be
--   considered stale. If this parameter is not specified, the stickiness
--   session lasts for the duration of the browser session.
lBCookieStickinessPolicy_cookieExpirationPeriod :: Lens' LBCookieStickinessPolicy (Maybe Integer)

-- | Information about an Elastic Load Balancing resource limit for your
--   AWS account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLimit</a> smart constructor.
data Limit
Limit' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Limit

-- | The name of the limit. The possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classic-listeners</li>
--   <li>classic-load-balancers</li>
--   <li>classic-registered-instances</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:Limit'] :: Limit -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum value of the limit.
[$sel:max:Limit'] :: Limit -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Limit</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Limit'</a>, <a>limit_name</a> - The name of the limit.
--   The possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classic-listeners</li>
--   <li>classic-load-balancers</li>
--   <li>classic-registered-instances</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:max:Limit'</a>, <a>limit_max</a> - The maximum value of the
--   limit.
newLimit :: Limit

-- | The name of the limit. The possible values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>classic-listeners</li>
--   <li>classic-load-balancers</li>
--   <li>classic-registered-instances</li>
--   </ul>
limit_name :: Lens' Limit (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum value of the limit.
limit_max :: Lens' Limit (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about a listener.
--   
--   For information about the protocols and the ports supported by Elastic
--   Load Balancing, see <a>Listeners for Your Classic Load Balancer</a> in
--   the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListener</a> smart constructor.
data Listener
Listener' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Int -> Natural -> Listener

-- | The protocol to use for routing traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is TCP or SSL, the back-end protocol must be
--   TCP or SSL. If the front-end protocol is HTTP or HTTPS, the back-end
--   protocol must be HTTP or HTTPS.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
[$sel:instanceProtocol:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.
[$sel:sSLCertificateId:Listener'] :: Listener -> Maybe Text

-- | The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
[$sel:protocol:Listener'] :: Listener -> Text

-- | The port on which the load balancer is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can
--   specify any port from the range 1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can
--   specify any port from the following list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587,
--   1024-65535.
[$sel:loadBalancerPort:Listener'] :: Listener -> Int

-- | The port on which the instance is listening.
[$sel:instancePort:Listener'] :: Listener -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>Listener</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProtocol:Listener'</a>,
--   <a>listener_instanceProtocol</a> - The protocol to use for routing
--   traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is TCP or SSL, the back-end protocol must be
--   TCP or SSL. If the front-end protocol is HTTP or HTTPS, the back-end
--   protocol must be HTTP or HTTPS.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSLCertificateId:Listener'</a>,
--   <a>listener_sSLCertificateId</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the server certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_protocol</a> - The load
--   balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or
--   SSL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerPort:Listener'</a>,
--   <a>listener_loadBalancerPort</a> - The port on which the load balancer
--   is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can specify any port from the range
--   1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can specify any port from the following
--   list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587, 1024-65535.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancePort:Listener'</a>, <a>listener_instancePort</a> - The
--   port on which the instance is listening.
newListener :: Text -> Int -> Natural -> Listener

-- | The protocol to use for routing traffic to instances: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
--   
--   If the front-end protocol is TCP or SSL, the back-end protocol must be
--   TCP or SSL. If the front-end protocol is HTTP or HTTPS, the back-end
--   protocol must be HTTP or HTTPS.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is secure, (HTTPS or SSL), the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must also be secure.
--   
--   If there is another listener with the same <tt>InstancePort</tt> whose
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> is HTTP or TCP, the listener's
--   <tt>InstanceProtocol</tt> must be HTTP or TCP.
listener_instanceProtocol :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the server certificate.
listener_sSLCertificateId :: Lens' Listener (Maybe Text)

-- | The load balancer transport protocol to use for routing: HTTP, HTTPS,
--   TCP, or SSL.
listener_protocol :: Lens' Listener Text

-- | The port on which the load balancer is listening. On EC2-VPC, you can
--   specify any port from the range 1-65535. On EC2-Classic, you can
--   specify any port from the following list: 25, 80, 443, 465, 587,
--   1024-65535.
listener_loadBalancerPort :: Lens' Listener Int

-- | The port on which the instance is listening.
listener_instancePort :: Lens' Listener Natural

-- | The policies enabled for a listener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListenerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data ListenerDescription
ListenerDescription' :: Maybe Listener -> Maybe [Text] -> ListenerDescription

-- | The listener.
[$sel:listener:ListenerDescription'] :: ListenerDescription -> Maybe Listener

-- | The policies. If there are no policies enabled, the list is empty.
[$sel:policyNames:ListenerDescription'] :: ListenerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>ListenerDescription</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:listener:ListenerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>listenerDescription_listener</a> - The listener.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNames:ListenerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>listenerDescription_policyNames</a> - The policies. If there are no
--   policies enabled, the list is empty.
newListenerDescription :: ListenerDescription

-- | The listener.
listenerDescription_listener :: Lens' ListenerDescription (Maybe Listener)

-- | The policies. If there are no policies enabled, the list is empty.
listenerDescription_policyNames :: Lens' ListenerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The attributes for a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerAttributes
LoadBalancerAttributes' :: Maybe ConnectionDraining -> Maybe [AdditionalAttribute] -> Maybe ConnectionSettings -> Maybe AccessLog -> Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing -> LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete
--   before the load balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or
--   unhealthy instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:connectionDraining:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe ConnectionDraining

-- | Any additional attributes.
[$sel:additionalAttributes:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe [AdditionalAttribute]

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows the connections to remain idle
--   (no data is sent over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:connectionSettings:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe ConnectionSettings

-- | If enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information of all
--   requests and delivers the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you
--   specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Classic
--   Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:accessLog:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe AccessLog

-- | If enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across
--   all instances regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:crossZoneLoadBalancing:LoadBalancerAttributes'] :: LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionDraining:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_connectionDraining</a> - If enabled, the
--   load balancer allows existing requests to complete before the load
--   balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or unhealthy
--   instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:additionalAttributes:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_additionalAttributes</a> - Any additional
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionSettings:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_connectionSettings</a> - If enabled, the
--   load balancer allows the connections to remain idle (no data is sent
--   over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessLog:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_accessLog</a> - If enabled, the load
--   balancer captures detailed information of all requests and delivers
--   the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Classic
--   Load Balancers Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:crossZoneLoadBalancing:LoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerAttributes_crossZoneLoadBalancing</a> - If enabled, the
--   load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across all instances
--   regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
newLoadBalancerAttributes :: LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete
--   before the load balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or
--   unhealthy instance.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Connection Draining</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_connectionDraining :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe ConnectionDraining)

-- | Any additional attributes.
loadBalancerAttributes_additionalAttributes :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe [AdditionalAttribute])

-- | If enabled, the load balancer allows the connections to remain idle
--   (no data is sent over the connection) for the specified duration.
--   
--   By default, Elastic Load Balancing maintains a 60-second idle
--   connection timeout for both front-end and back-end connections of your
--   load balancer. For more information, see <a>Configure Idle Connection
--   Timeout</a> in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_connectionSettings :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe ConnectionSettings)

-- | If enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information of all
--   requests and delivers the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you
--   specify.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Enable Access Logs</a> in the <i>Classic
--   Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_accessLog :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe AccessLog)

-- | If enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across
--   all instances regardless of the Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerAttributes_crossZoneLoadBalancing :: Lens' LoadBalancerAttributes (Maybe CrossZoneLoadBalancing)

-- | Information about a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerDescription</a> smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerDescription
LoadBalancerDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [BackendServerDescription] -> Maybe Policies -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Instance] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe SourceSecurityGroup -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ListenerDescription] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe HealthCheck -> Maybe Text -> LoadBalancerDescription

-- | The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.
[$sel:canonicalHostedZoneNameID:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zones for the load balancer.
[$sel:availabilityZones:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Information about your EC2 instances.
[$sel:backendServerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [BackendServerDescription]

-- | The policies defined for the load balancer.
[$sel:policies:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Policies

-- | The type of load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internet-facing</tt>, the load balancer has
--   a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
[$sel:scheme:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time the load balancer was created.
[$sel:createdTime:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The IDs of the instances for the load balancer.
[$sel:instances:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Instance]

-- | The security groups for the load balancer. Valid only for load
--   balancers in a VPC.
[$sel:securityGroups:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The security group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of
--   your inbound rules for your registered instances. To only allow
--   traffic from load balancers, add a security group rule that specifies
--   this source security group as the inbound source.
[$sel:sourceSecurityGroup:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe SourceSecurityGroup

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
[$sel:dNSName:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The listeners for the load balancer.
[$sel:listenerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [ListenerDescription]

-- | The IDs of the subnets for the load balancer.
[$sel:subnets:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.
[$sel:vPCId:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the health checks conducted on the load balancer.
[$sel:healthCheck:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe HealthCheck

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure a Custom Domain Name</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
[$sel:canonicalHostedZoneName:LoadBalancerDescription'] :: LoadBalancerDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:canonicalHostedZoneNameID:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneNameID</a> - The ID of
--   the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_availabilityZones</a> - The Availability
--   Zones for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:backendServerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_backendServerDescriptions</a> - Information
--   about your EC2 instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_policies</a> - The policies defined for the
--   load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheme:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_scheme</a> - The type of load balancer.
--   Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internet-facing</tt>, the load balancer has
--   a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_createdTime</a> - The date and time the
--   load balancer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instances:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_instances</a> - The IDs of the instances
--   for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroups:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_securityGroups</a> - The security groups
--   for the load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSecurityGroup:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_sourceSecurityGroup</a> - The security
--   group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of your inbound
--   rules for your registered instances. To only allow traffic from load
--   balancers, add a security group rule that specifies this source
--   security group as the inbound source.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dNSName:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_dNSName</a> - The DNS name of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:listenerDescriptions:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_listenerDescriptions</a> - The listeners
--   for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnets:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_subnets</a> - The IDs of the subnets for
--   the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vPCId:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_vPCId</a> - The ID of the VPC for the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_loadBalancerName</a> - The name of the load
--   balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheck:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_healthCheck</a> - Information about the
--   health checks conducted on the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:canonicalHostedZoneName:LoadBalancerDescription'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneName</a> - The DNS name
--   of the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure a Custom Domain Name</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
newLoadBalancerDescription :: LoadBalancerDescription

-- | The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneNameID :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Availability Zones for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_availabilityZones :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | Information about your EC2 instances.
loadBalancerDescription_backendServerDescriptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [BackendServerDescription])

-- | The policies defined for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_policies :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Policies)

-- | The type of load balancer. Valid only for load balancers in a VPC.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internet-facing</tt>, the load balancer has
--   a public DNS name that resolves to a public IP address.
--   
--   If <tt>Scheme</tt> is <tt>internal</tt>, the load balancer has a
--   public DNS name that resolves to a private IP address.
loadBalancerDescription_scheme :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time the load balancer was created.
loadBalancerDescription_createdTime :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The IDs of the instances for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_instances :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Instance])

-- | The security groups for the load balancer. Valid only for load
--   balancers in a VPC.
loadBalancerDescription_securityGroups :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The security group for the load balancer, which you can use as part of
--   your inbound rules for your registered instances. To only allow
--   traffic from load balancers, add a security group rule that specifies
--   this source security group as the inbound source.
loadBalancerDescription_sourceSecurityGroup :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe SourceSecurityGroup)

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_dNSName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The listeners for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_listenerDescriptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [ListenerDescription])

-- | The IDs of the subnets for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_subnets :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_vPCId :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_loadBalancerName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the health checks conducted on the load balancer.
loadBalancerDescription_healthCheck :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe HealthCheck)

-- | The DNS name of the load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Configure a Custom Domain Name</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
loadBalancerDescription_canonicalHostedZoneName :: Lens' LoadBalancerDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The policies for a load balancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicies</a> smart constructor.
data Policies
Policies' :: Maybe [AppCookieStickinessPolicy] -> Maybe [LBCookieStickinessPolicy] -> Maybe [Text] -> Policies

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.
[$sel:appCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'] :: Policies -> Maybe [AppCookieStickinessPolicy]

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.
[$sel:lBCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'] :: Policies -> Maybe [LBCookieStickinessPolicy]

-- | The policies other than the stickiness policies.
[$sel:otherPolicies:Policies'] :: Policies -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Policies</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:appCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'</a>,
--   <a>policies_appCookieStickinessPolicies</a> - The stickiness policies
--   created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lBCookieStickinessPolicies:Policies'</a>,
--   <a>policies_lBCookieStickinessPolicies</a> - The stickiness policies
--   created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:otherPolicies:Policies'</a>, <a>policies_otherPolicies</a> -
--   The policies other than the stickiness policies.
newPolicies :: Policies

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateAppCookieStickinessPolicy.
policies_appCookieStickinessPolicies :: Lens' Policies (Maybe [AppCookieStickinessPolicy])

-- | The stickiness policies created using CreateLBCookieStickinessPolicy.
policies_lBCookieStickinessPolicies :: Lens' Policies (Maybe [LBCookieStickinessPolicy])

-- | The policies other than the stickiness policies.
policies_otherPolicies :: Lens' Policies (Maybe [Text])

-- | Information about a policy attribute type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyAttributeTypeDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PolicyAttributeTypeDescription
PolicyAttributeTypeDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PolicyAttributeTypeDescription

-- | The type of the attribute. For example, <tt>Boolean</tt> or
--   <tt>Integer</tt>.
[$sel:attributeType:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the attribute.
[$sel:attributeName:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The cardinality of the attribute.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE(1) : Single value required</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_ONE(0..1) : Up to one value is allowed</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_MORE(0..*) : Optional. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   <li>ONE_OR_MORE(1..*0) : Required. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:cardinality:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | A description of the attribute.
[$sel:description:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The default value of the attribute, if applicable.
[$sel:defaultValue:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'] :: PolicyAttributeTypeDescription -> Maybe Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,

--   attribute. For example, <tt>Boolean</tt> or <tt>Integer</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeName:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_attributeName</a> - The name of the
--   attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cardinality:PolicyAttributeTypeDescription'</a>,
--   <a>policyAttributeTypeDescription_cardinality</a> - The cardinality of
--   the attribute.
--   
--   Valid values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ONE(1) : Single value required</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_ONE(0..1) : Up to one value is allowed</li>
--   <li>ZERO_OR_MORE(0..*) : Optional. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   <li>ONE_OR_MORE(1..*0) : Required. Multiple values are allowed</li>
--   </ul>

--   the attribute.

--   of the attribute, if applicable.

--

-- | Replaces the current set of policies for the specified load balancer
--   port with the specified set of policies.
--   
--   To enable back-end server authentication, use
--   SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer.
--   
--   For more information about setting policies, see <a>Update the SSL
--   Negotiation Configuration</a>, <a>Duration-Based Session
--   Stickiness</a>, and <a>Application-Controlled Session Stickiness</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener

-- | Contains the parameters for SetLoadBalancePoliciesOfListener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener
SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener' :: Text -> Int -> [Text] -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener -> Text

-- | The external port of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerPort:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener -> Int

-- | The names of the policies. This list must include all policies to be
--   enabled. If you omit a policy that is currently enabled, it is
--   disabled. If the list is empty, all current policies are disabled.
[$sel:policyNames:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener_loadBalancerName</a> - The name
--   of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerPort:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener_loadBalancerPort</a> - The
--   external port of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNames:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener_policyNames</a> - The names of
--   the policies. This list must include all policies to be enabled. If
--   you omit a policy that is currently enabled, it is disabled. If the
--   list is empty, all current policies are disabled.
newSetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener :: Text -> Int -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener

-- | The name of the load balancer.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener_loadBalancerName :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener Text

-- | The external port of the load balancer.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener_loadBalancerPort :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener Int

-- | The names of the policies. This list must include all policies to be
--   enabled. If you omit a policy that is currently enabled, it is
--   disabled. If the list is empty, all current policies are disabled.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener_policyNames :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener [Text]

-- | Contains the output of SetLoadBalancePoliciesOfListener.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse
SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse' :: Int -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListenerResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener.SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener


-- | Replaces the set of policies associated with the specified port on
--   which the EC2 instance is listening with a new set of policies. At
--   this time, only the back-end server authentication policy type can be
--   applied to the instance ports; this policy type is composed of
--   multiple public key policies.
--   
--   Each time you use <tt>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer</tt> to
--   enable the policies, use the <tt>PolicyNames</tt> parameter to list
--   the policies that you want to enable.
--   
--   You can use DescribeLoadBalancers or DescribeLoadBalancerPolicies to
--   verify that the policy is associated with the EC2 instance.
--   
--   For more information about enabling back-end instance authentication,
--   see <a>Configure Back-end Instance Authentication</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>. For more information about Proxy
--   Protocol, see <a>Configure Proxy Protocol Support</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer

-- | Contains the parameters for SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer
SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer' :: Text -> Int -> [Text] -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer -> Text

-- | The port number associated with the EC2 instance.
[$sel:instancePort:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer -> Int

-- | The names of the policies. If the list is empty, then all current
--   polices are removed from the EC2 instance.
[$sel:policyNames:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer'] :: SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer_loadBalancerName</a> - The
--   name of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancePort:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer_instancePort</a> - The port
--   number associated with the EC2 instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyNames:SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer_policyNames</a> - The names
--   of the policies. If the list is empty, then all current polices are
--   removed from the EC2 instance.
newSetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer :: Text -> Int -> SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer_loadBalancerName :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer Text

-- | The port number associated with the EC2 instance.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer_instancePort :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer Int

-- | The names of the policies. If the list is empty, then all current
--   polices are removed from the EC2 instance.
setLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer_policyNames :: Lens' SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer [Text]

-- | Contains the output of SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServerResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.

-- | Sets the certificate that terminates the specified listener's SSL
--   connections. The specified certificate replaces any prior certificate
--   that was used on the same load balancer and port.
--   
--   For more information about updating your SSL certificate, see
--   <a>Replace the SSL Certificate for Your Load Balancer</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.ELB.SetLoadBalancerListenerSSLCertificate

-- | Removes one or more tags from the specified load balancer.
module Network.AWS.ELB.RemoveTags

-- | Contains the parameters for RemoveTags.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveTags</a> smart constructor.
data RemoveTags
RemoveTags' :: [Text] -> NonEmpty TagKeyOnly -> RemoveTags

-- | The name of the load balancer. You can specify a maximum of one load
--   balancer name.
[$sel:loadBalancerNames:RemoveTags'] :: RemoveTags -> [Text]

-- | The list of tag keys to remove.
[$sel:tags:RemoveTags'] :: RemoveTags -> NonEmpty TagKeyOnly

-- | Create a value of <a>RemoveTags</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerNames:RemoveTags'</a>,
--   <a>removeTags_loadBalancerNames</a> - The name of the load balancer.
--   You can specify a maximum of one load balancer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RemoveTags'</a>, <a>removeTags_tags</a> - The list of tag
--   keys to remove.
newRemoveTags :: NonEmpty TagKeyOnly -> RemoveTags

-- | The name of the load balancer. You can specify a maximum of one load
--   balancer name.
removeTags_loadBalancerNames :: Lens' RemoveTags [Text]

-- | The list of tag keys to remove.
removeTags_tags :: Lens' RemoveTags (NonEmpty TagKeyOnly)

-- | Contains the output of RemoveTags.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRemoveTagsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data RemoveTagsResponse
RemoveTagsResponse' :: Int -> RemoveTagsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RemoveTagsResponse'] :: RemoveTagsResponse -> Int

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RemoveTagsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>removeTagsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newRemoveTagsResponse :: Int -> RemoveTagsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
removeTagsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RemoveTagsResponse Int

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.RemoveTags.RemoveTags


-- | Adds the specified instances to the specified load balancer.
--   
--   The instance must be a running instance in the same network as the
--   load balancer (EC2-Classic or the same VPC). If you have EC2-Classic
--   instances and a load balancer in a VPC with ClassicLink enabled, you
--   can link the EC2-Classic instances to that VPC and then register the
--   linked EC2-Classic instances with the load balancer in the VPC.
--   
--   Note that <tt>RegisterInstanceWithLoadBalancer</tt> completes when the
--   request has been registered. Instance registration takes a little time
--   to complete. To check the state of the registered instances, use
--   DescribeLoadBalancers or DescribeInstanceHealth.
--   
--   After the instance is registered, it starts receiving traffic and
--   requests from the load balancer. Any instance that is not in one of
--   the Availability Zones registered for the load balancer is moved to
--   the <tt>OutOfService</tt> state. If an Availability Zone is added to
--   the load balancer later, any instances registered with the load
--   balancer move to the <tt>InService</tt> state.
--   
--   To deregister instances from a load balancer, use
--   DeregisterInstancesFromLoadBalancer.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Register or De-Register EC2 Instances</a>
--   in the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer

-- | Contains the parameters for RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer' :: Text -> [Instance] -> RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer'] :: RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer -> Text

-- | The IDs of the instances.
[$sel:instances:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer'] :: RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer -> [Instance]

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstancesWithLoadBalancer_loadBalancerName</a> - The name
--   of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instances:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstancesWithLoadBalancer_instances</a> - The IDs of the
--   instances.
newRegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer :: Text -> RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
registerInstancesWithLoadBalancer_loadBalancerName :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer Text

-- | The IDs of the instances.
registerInstancesWithLoadBalancer_instances :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer [Instance]

-- | Contains the output of RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse' :: Maybe [Instance] -> Int -> RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The updated list of instances for the load balancer.
[$sel:instances:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse'] :: RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse -> Maybe [Instance]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse'] :: RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instances:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse_instances</a> - The
--   updated list of instances for the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newRegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse :: Int -> RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The updated list of instances for the load balancer.
registerInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse_instances :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse (Maybe [Instance])

-- | The response's http status code.
registerInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancerResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer.RegisterInstancesWithLoadBalancer


-- | Modifies the attributes of the specified load balancer.
--   
--   You can modify the load balancer attributes, such as
--   <tt>AccessLogs</tt>, <tt>ConnectionDraining</tt>, and
--   <tt>CrossZoneLoadBalancing</tt> by either enabling or disabling them.
--   Or, you can modify the load balancer attribute
--   <tt>ConnectionSettings</tt> by specifying an idle connection timeout
--   value for your load balancer.
--   
--   For more information, see the following in the /Classic Load Balancers
--   Guide/:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Cross-Zone Load Balancing</a></li>
--   <li><a>Connection Draining</a></li>
--   <li><a>Access Logs</a></li>
--   <li><a>Idle Connection Timeout</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.ELB.ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes

-- | Contains the parameters for ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyLoadBalancerAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes' :: Text -> LoadBalancerAttributes -> ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes'] :: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes -> Text

-- | The attributes for the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerAttributes:ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes'] :: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes -> LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>modifyLoadBalancerAttributes_loadBalancerName</a> - The name of the
--   load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerAttributes:ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>modifyLoadBalancerAttributes_loadBalancerAttributes</a> - The
--   attributes for the load balancer.
newModifyLoadBalancerAttributes :: Text -> LoadBalancerAttributes -> ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes

-- | The name of the load balancer.
modifyLoadBalancerAttributes_loadBalancerName :: Lens' ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes Text

-- | The attributes for the load balancer.
modifyLoadBalancerAttributes_loadBalancerAttributes :: Lens' ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes LoadBalancerAttributes

-- | Contains the output of ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse
ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse' :: Maybe LoadBalancerAttributes -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ModifyLoadBalancerAttributesResponse

--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Adds the specified Availability Zones to the set of Availability Zones
--   for the specified load balancer in EC2-Classic or a default VPC.
--   
--   For load balancers in a non-default VPC, use
--   AttachLoadBalancerToSubnets.
--   
--   The load balancer evenly distributes requests across all its
--   registered Availability Zones that contain instances. For more
--   information, see <a>Add or Remove Availability Zones</a> in the
--   <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.ELB.EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | Contains the parameters for EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer' :: Text -> [Text] -> EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'] :: EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer -> Text

-- | The Availability Zones. These must be in the same region as the load
--   balancer.
[$sel:availabilityZones:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'] :: EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_loadBalancerName</a> - The
--   name of the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_availabilityZones</a> - The
--   Availability Zones. These must be in the same region as the load
--   balancer.
newEnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer :: Text -> EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_loadBalancerName :: Lens' EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer Text

-- | The Availability Zones. These must be in the same region as the load
--   balancer.
enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_availabilityZones :: Lens' EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | Contains the output of EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> Int -> EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The updated list of Availability Zones for the load balancer.
[$sel:availabilityZones:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse'] :: EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse -> Maybe [Text]

[$sel:httpStatus:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse'] :: EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse -> Int

--   <a>EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>enableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.ELB.EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.ELB.EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.EnableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer


-- | Removes the specified Availability Zones from the set of Availability
--   Zones for the specified load balancer in EC2-Classic or a default VPC.
--   
--   For load balancers in a non-default VPC, use
--   DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets.
--   
--   There must be at least one Availability Zone registered with a load
--   balancer at all times. After an Availability Zone is removed, all
--   instances registered with the load balancer that are in the removed
--   Availability Zone go into the <tt>OutOfService</tt> state. Then, the
--   load balancer attempts to equally balance the traffic among its
--   remaining Availability Zones.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Add or Remove Availability Zones</a> in
--   the <i>Classic Load Balancers Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.ELB.DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | Contains the parameters for DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer' :: Text -> [Text] -> DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'] :: DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer -> Text

-- | The Availability Zones.
[$sel:availabilityZones:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'] :: DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_loadBalancerName</a> - The
--   name of the load balancer.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_availabilityZones</a> - The
--   Availability Zones.
newDisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer :: Text -> DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | The name of the load balancer.
disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_loadBalancerName :: Lens' DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer Text

-- | The Availability Zones.
disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer_availabilityZones :: Lens' DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer [Text]

-- | Contains the output for DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse
DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> Int -> DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The remaining Availability Zones for the load balancer.
[$sel:availabilityZones:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse'] :: DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse'] :: DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse_availabilityZones</a>
--   - The remaining Availability Zones for the load balancer.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse_httpStatus</a> -
--   The response's http status code.
newDisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse :: Int -> DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse

-- | The remaining Availability Zones for the load balancer.
disableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse_availabilityZones :: Lens' DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancerResponse (Maybe [Text])

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.ELB.DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.ELB.DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer.DisableAvailabilityZonesForLoadBalancer

-- | Removes the specified subnets from the set of configured subnets for
--   the load balancer.
--   
--   After a subnet is removed, all EC2 instances registered with the load
--   balancer in the removed subnet go into the <tt>OutOfService</tt>
--   state. Then, the load balancer balances the traffic among the
--   remaining routable subnets.
module Network.AWS.ELB.DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets

-- | Contains the parameters for DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets</a> smart constructor.
data DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets
DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets' :: Text -> [Text] -> DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets

[$sel:loadBalancerName:DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets'] :: DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets -> Text

-- | The IDs of the subnets.
[$sel:subnets:DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets'] :: DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets'</a>,
--   <a>detachLoadBalancerFromSubnets_loadBalancerName</a> - The name of
--   the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnets:DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets'</a>,
--   <a>detachLoadBalancerFromSubnets_subnets</a> - The IDs of the subnets.
newDetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets :: Text -> DetachLoadBalancerFromSubnets

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachLoadBalancerFromSubnetsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Describes the tags associated with the specified load balancers.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeTags</a> smart constructor.

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   balancers.

--   <a>describeTagsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status

-- | Describes the specified the load balancers. If no load balancers are
--   specified, the call describes all of your load balancers.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.ELB.DescribeLoadBalancers

-- | Contains the parameters for DescribeLoadBalancers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLoadBalancers</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeLoadBalancers
DescribeLoadBalancers' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> DescribeLoadBalancers

-- | The maximum number of results to return with this call (a number from
--   1 to 400). The default is 400.
[$sel:pageSize:DescribeLoadBalancers'] :: DescribeLoadBalancers -> Maybe Natural

-- | The names of the load balancers.
[$sel:loadBalancerNames:DescribeLoadBalancers'] :: DescribeLoadBalancers -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from
--   a previous call.)
[$sel:marker:DescribeLoadBalancers'] :: DescribeLoadBalancers -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeLoadBalancers</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:DescribeLoadBalancers'</a>,
--   <a>describeLoadBalancers_pageSize</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return with this call (a number from 1 to 400). The default is 400.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerNames:DescribeLoadBalancers'</a>,
--   <a>describeLoadBalancers_loadBalancerNames</a> - The names of the load
--   balancers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:DescribeLoadBalancers'</a>,
--   <a>describeLoadBalancers_marker</a> - The marker for the next set of
--   results. (You received this marker from a previous call.)
newDescribeLoadBalancers :: DescribeLoadBalancers

-- | The maximum number of results to return with this call (a number from
--   1 to 400). The default is 400.
describeLoadBalancers_pageSize :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancers (Maybe Natural)

-- | The names of the load balancers.
describeLoadBalancers_loadBalancerNames :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancers (Maybe [Text])

-- | The marker for the next set of results. (You received this marker from
--   a previous call.)
describeLoadBalancers_marker :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancers (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the parameters for DescribeLoadBalancers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLoadBalancersResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Information about the load balancers.

-- | The marker to use when requesting the next set of results. If there
--   are no additional results, the string is empty.

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeLoadBalancersResponse'] :: DescribeLoadBalancersResponse -> Int

--   optional fields omitted.
--

-- | Describes the specified load balancer policy types or all load
--   balancer policy types.
--   
--   The description of each type indicates how it can be used. For
--   example, some policies can be used only with layer 7 listeners, some
--   policies can be used only with layer 4 listeners, and some policies
--   can be used only with your EC2 instances.
--   
--   You can use CreateLoadBalancerPolicy to create a policy configuration
--   for any of these policy types. Then, depending on the policy type, use
--   either SetLoadBalancerPoliciesOfListener or
--   SetLoadBalancerPoliciesForBackendServer to set the policy.
module Network.AWS.ELB.DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes

-- | Contains the parameters for DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes
DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes' :: Maybe [Text] -> DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes

-- | The names of the policy types. If no names are specified, describes
--   all policy types defined by Elastic Load Balancing.
[$sel:policyTypeNames:DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes'] :: DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyTypeNames:DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes'</a>,
--   <a>describeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes_policyTypeNames</a> - The names of
--   the policy types. If no names are specified, describes all policy
--   types defined by Elastic Load Balancing.
newDescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes :: DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes

-- | The names of the policy types. If no names are specified, describes
--   all policy types defined by Elastic Load Balancing.
describeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes_policyTypeNames :: Lens' DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes (Maybe [Text])

-- | Contains the output of DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypes.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Information about the policy types.
[$sel:policyTypeDescriptions:DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse'] :: DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse -> Maybe [PolicyTypeDescription]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse'] :: DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>$sel:policyTypeDescriptions:DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse_policyTypeDescriptions</a>
--   - Information about the policy types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeLoadBalancerPolicyTypesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
